intro: Pabstiella discors, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Pabstiella discors is a perennial species, with a lifespan spanning several years, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native ecosystems.
